item.title: 斯托纳拉斯称一切迹象表明欧洲央行将于四月降息经济流
item.description: 欧洲央行理事会成员亚尼斯-斯托纳拉斯（Yannis Stournaras）表示，目前看来欧洲央行有可能在下一次会议上降息，但他补充说，现在就断言这一举措将会发生还为时过早。【原文：An European Central Bank interest-rate cut at the next meeting currently looks likely, said Governing Council member Yannis Stournaras, adding that it’s too early to say for certain that such a move will happen.】

item.title: 让客户拥有风电场股份的英国能源公司濒临破产
item.description: 英国一家允许家庭和社区拥有太阳能和风能农场股份的能源公司在发给客户的一封电子邮件中称，该公司已进入管理阶段。【原文：A UK energy company that allows households and communities to own a stake in solar and wind farms has entered administration, according to an email it sent to customers.】

item.title: 电力成本引发商业骚动，法国撤换 EDF 首席执行官
item.description: 法国政府表示，法国电力公司（Electricite de France SA）首席执行官吕克-雷蒙（Luc Remont）即将下台，因为这家国有电力公司面临着大型工业客户对电费日益增长的抱怨。【原文：The French government said Electricite de France SA Chief Executive Officer Luc Remont is stepping down as the state-owned utility faces increasing complaints from large industrial clients over the cost of electricity.】

item.title: 负责复活智利反叛电信的奇特夫妇
item.description: 作为自诩为梦之队的一员，智利 WOM 公司的新任首席执行官和董事长是一对有着奇怪历史的奇葩。【原文：For part of a self-professed dream team, the new CEO and chairman of Chile’s WOM are an odd couple with an odd history.】

item.title: 特斯拉的散户粉丝以前所未有的速度购买股票
item.description: 特斯拉公司（Tesla Inc.它在全球的销售额急剧下降。就连华尔街最狂热的 "大牛股 "也变得谨慎起来。但有一个群体正在前所未有地购买这家电动汽车制造商的股票：那就是首席执行官埃隆-马斯克的粉丝们。【原文：Tesla Inc.’s stock is in a freefall. Its sales are plunging around the world. Even its most avid Wall Street bulls are turning cautious. But one group is buying the electric-vehicle maker’s shares like never before: CEO Elon Musk’s fans.】

item.title: 芯片公司向德国提出 60 亿欧元补贴申请
item.description: 芯片制造行业的公司要求从德国最新的资助计划中获得三倍于现有补贴的资金，这为德国下届政府面临的首批挑战之一。【原文：Companies in the chipmaking industry are asking for three times the available subsidies from Germany’s latest funding program, setting up one of the first challenges for the country’s next government.】

item.title: 关注美联储可能降息，国债再次反弹
item.description: 由于经济忧虑加强了对降息的押注，美国国债市场正朝着本月最佳单周涨幅迈进。【原文：The US Treasury market is heading for its best weekly gain this month as economic angst reinforces bets on interest-rate cuts.】

item.title: 大韩航空与波音和通用电气正式达成价值 330 亿美元的喷气机交易
item.description: 大韩航空在收购韩亚航空（Asiana Airlines Inc.【原文：Korean Air signed contracts with Boeing Co. and General Electric Co. to purchase aircraft and engines after its acquisition of Asiana Airlines Inc. catapulted it into the world’s top 10 carriers.】

item.title: 银行将为贝恩的 Apleona 交易启动 27 亿欧元的债务销售
item.description: 贝恩资本（Bain Capital）收购了德国设施管理公司 Apleona Group GmbH，银行正准备卸下约 27 亿欧元（29 亿美元）的债务。【原文：Banks are gearing up to offload about €2.7 billion ($2.9 billion) of debt backing Bain Capital’s acquisition of German facility-management company Apleona Group GmbH.】

item.title: 社会保障将恢复延期支付债务催收款
item.description: 社会保障局将恢复自 2020 年 3 月以来因大流行病而暂停的债务追收工作。【原文：The Social Security Administration will resume debt collection that had been on hold since March 2020 due to the pandemic.】

item.title: 哥伦比亚新任财政部长表示将增加税收收入
item.description: 哥伦比亚即将上任的财政部长格尔曼-阿维拉（German Ávila）表示，他将努力增加政府收入，以控制自大流行病以来最严重的预算赤字。【原文：Colombia’s incoming finance chief German Ávila said he’ll seek to boost government revenues to rein in the widest budget deficit since the pandemic.】

item.title: 耐克市值跌破 1000 亿美元，扭亏为盈陷入困境
item.description: 耐克公司的财报显示，该公司的收入和盈利能力仍将面临压力，周五该公司股价暴跌，使其市值自 "Covid-19 "大流行以来首次跌破 1000 亿美元。【原文：Nike Inc. shares tumbled on Friday, sending the sportswear company’s market value below $100 billion for the first time since the depths of the Covid-19 pandemic after its earnings report signaled that revenue and profitability will remain under pressure.】

item.title: 慧科伦敦新总部将以 2 亿英镑出售
item.description: 支付公司 Wise Plc 的新总部已由该项目的开发商挂牌出售，这是卖家对伦敦写字楼市场复苏越来越有信心的最新迹象。【原文：The new headquarters of payments company Wise Plc has been put up for sale by the developer behind the project, the latest sign that sellers are becoming more confident in a London office market recovery.】

item.title: 安杜里尔考虑在英国建立无人机工厂，以争取欧洲防务合同
item.description:
随着各国政府提高国防开支，总部位于加利福尼亚州的公司正在欧洲拓展业务

。【原文：

California-based company is pitching for business in Europe as governments boost defense spending

】

item.title: 前联邦工作人员在地方选举中找到出路
item.description:
从被唾弃的公务员到沮丧的居民，越来越多的美国人开始考虑竞选公职。【原文：

From spurned civil servants to frustrated residents, a surge of Americans are considering running for office. 

】

item.title: 德国扣押波罗的海一艘油轮上的俄罗斯石油
item.description: 据《明镜周刊》报道，德国海关当局扣押了一批俄罗斯石油和装载这批石油的油轮，此举有可能进一步加剧与莫斯科的紧张关系。【原文：Germany’s customs authority seized a cargo of Russian oil and the tanker that has holding it, Der Spiegel reported, a move that risks further ratcheting tensions with Moscow.】

item.title: 美联储古尔斯比认为一次性关税会带来短暂通胀
item.description: 芝加哥联邦储备银行行长古尔斯比（Austan Goolsbee）表示，如果关税的范围有限，那么关税对通胀的影响可能只是暂时的。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of Chicago President Austan Goolsbee said the inflationary impact from tariffs could be transitory if they were limited in scope.】

item.title: 巴拿马投资者看淡特朗普威胁，引发债券大涨
item.description: 巴拿马濒临失去其投资级信用评级的边缘，正在努力实现预算目标，并与美国总统唐纳德-特朗普就其最大收入来源之一的巴拿马运河展开拉锯战。【原文：Panama is on the verge of losing its investment-grade credit rating, struggling to meet budget targets and engaged in a tug of war with President Donald Trump over the Panama Canal, one of its biggest revenue earners.】

item.title: 铜、金价格上涨，中国顶级金属矿产商利润激增 52
item.description: 中国最大的金属生产商紫金矿业集团股份有限公司（Zijin Mining Group Co.【原文：Zijin Mining Group Co., China’s biggest metals producer, saw profit surge 52% last year on higher output, and rising prices of copper and gold.】

item.title: 美联储威廉姆斯称适度限制利率是适当的
item.description: 纽约联邦储备银行行长约翰-威廉姆斯（John Williams）表示，移民、贸易和财政政策的快速变化将如何改变经济存在高度不确定性，但目前的货币政策立场是适当的，使美国中央银行能够很好地应对不断变化的情况。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of New York President John Williams said there’s a high level of uncertainty over how rapid changes to immigration, trade and fiscal policy will alter the economy, but the current stance of monetary policy is appropriate and positions the US central bank well to respond to changing conditions.】

item.title: 加拿大零售销售在贸易忧虑和减税政策影响下疲软
item.description: 在贸易战不确定性的影响下，加拿大消费者连续第二个月缩减开支，部分扭转了联邦销售税暂停后年终销售增长的势头。【原文：Canadian consumers pared back their spending for a second straight month amid trade war uncertainty, partially reversing a year-end boost in sales after a federal sales tax was paused.】

item.title: 亿万富翁标致计划在业绩下滑后改变投资公司
item.description: 由亿万富翁标致家族控制的投资公司在经历了一系列失误之后，计划对其资产进行全面整顿，同时准备由新一代接手。【原文：The investment firm controlled by the billionaire Peugeot family plans to overhaul its assets after a series of missteps and as a new generation prepares to take over.】

item.title: 印度官员称正 "积极 "与美国就贸易协定开展合作
item.description: 据一位新德里高级官员透露，印度和美国正在 "积极 "制定双边贸易协定，而此时距离华盛顿开始实施互惠关税仅有几天时间。【原文：India and the US are “actively” working on a bilateral trade agreement, according to a senior New Delhi official, just days before Washington’s reciprocal tariffs kick in.】

item.title: 爱迪生公司首席执行官说，引发野火需要的不仅仅是一条输电线
item.description:
公用事业公司希望客户补充加州 210 亿美元的消防基金，并表示气候条件也难辞其咎。【原文：

Utilities want customers to replenish California’s $21 billion fire fund, saying climate conditions are also to blame.

】

item.title: 全球风险促使加拿大养老金重新思考 PE 战略
item.description: 安大略省教师退休金计划正在重新审视其私募股权投资部门，旨在更多地依靠合作伙伴关系，而不是拥有整个公司，以寻求降低风险。【原文：Ontario Teachers’ Pension Plan is re-examining its private equity unit, aiming to lean more on partnerships rather than owning entire firms as it seeks to mitigate risk.】

item.title: 埃塞俄比亚与债权人就 84 亿美元债务重组达成协议
item.description: 埃塞俄比亚财政部周五表示，埃塞俄比亚已就二十国集团（G20）共同框架下 84 亿美元国际债务重组的主要财务参数与其债券持有人达成原则性协议。【原文：Ethiopia has reached an agreement in principle with its bondholders on the main financial parameters for the restructuring of $8.4 billion of international debt under the G20 Common Framework, its finance ministry said on Friday.】

item.title: 尽管股价下滑，但对于富时罗素指数而言，大科技公司仍然太大了
item.description: 对于指数巨头富时罗素指数（FTSE Russell）来说，苹果公司（Apple Inc.【原文：For index behemoth FTSE Russell, the likes of Apple Inc. are still too big for comfort — even after the recent $2 trillion selloff that’s dethroned Big Tech from the stock market’s leaderboard.】

item.title: 爱尔兰总理称特朗普关税有可能导致欧盟在应对措施上分裂
item.description: 爱尔兰总理表示，美国总统唐纳德-特朗普逐个行业征收关税的做法有可能在欧盟成员国之间制造分裂。【原文：A sector-by-sector tariff approach by US President Donald Trump risks creating divisions among European Union member states, Ireland’s prime minister said.】

item.title: 德国美容零售商发出警告后跌至首次公开募股价格的一半
item.description: 香水零售商道格拉斯公司（Douglas AG）下调了销售额和利润指导，使其股价飙升至该德国公司重新加入法兰克福证券交易所一年来的新低。【原文：Perfume retailer Douglas AG lowered sales and profit guidance, sending its shares spiraling to a record low a year to the day the German company rejoined the Frankfurt stock exchange.】

item.title: 阿斯达降价试图夺回失去的英国市场份额
item.description: 英国第三大超市阿斯达（Asda）下调了 1500 种产品的价格，以重新赢得购物者的青睐，扭转市场份额下滑的趋势。【原文：Asda cut prices on 1,500 products as Britain’s third-largest supermarket seeks to win back shoppers and reverse a market share decline.】
